item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

[quote=“bengina, post:3, topic:326663”]What service provider (isp) does he/she use?
Does he/she use a router for his/her connection?

Has he/she installed/uninstalled any software within the last 3 weeks?

I have had a few problems like this a while ago they turned out to be 1. my router was blocking access to the port/ip all i needed to do was reset it. 2. My registry was corrupted and was for some reason stopping programes working properly.

Some ips are now blocking ips of copywrited sites/games, p2p software, music download sites, video download/streaming sites… which is a bitch… This depends on location.

Ips that are currently trialing this method that i know of are :

Virgin media - Eng
Be Broadband - Eng
Orange Home Broadband - Eng
Tiscali Broadband - Eng
Aol Broadband. Eng/Usa

These are all in england / usa.
Those are the ones i know of, there may be more.

Hope this helps :D[/quote]

If the use dosn’t have a firewall and they claim that there router is configured correctly then I would strongly suspect that the ISP is blocking the user.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

What service provider (isp) does he/she use?
Does he/she use a router for his/her connection?

Has he/she installed/uninstalled any software within the last 3 weeks?

I have had a few problems like this a while ago they turned out to be 1. my router was blocking access to the port/ip all i needed to do was reset it. 2. My registry was corrupted and was for some reason stopping programes working properly.

Some ips are now blocking ips of copywrited sites/games, p2p software, music download sites, video download/streaming sites… which is a bitch… This depends on location.

Ips that are currently trialing this method that i know of are :

Orange Home Broadband - Eng

These are all in england / usa.
